column4: Equifax under pressure from banks to shape up
column5: NEW YORK  Sept 21 U.S. consumer credit reporting bureau Equifax Inc risks losing support from banks unless it can show its database on millions of borrowers is secure from another cyber-attack. Banks are critical to Equifax's operations as they give the company information on consumer debts and payments which it compiles into credit reports sold to other creditors  including mortgage and credit card lenders  landlords and hospitals. "If we don't feel that they can do the job  then we

column4: New York proposes cyber security rules for credit-reporting  warns banks after Equifax breach
column5: NEW YORK (Thomson Reuters Regulatory Intelligence) - The New York Department of Financial Services on Monday responded to the Equifax cyber attack by proposing to extend its ground-breaking data protection rules to credit reporting firms  in an attempt to fill a perceived regulatory gap. The New York regulator also issued a warning to banks on potential risk from the massive data breach and issued guidelines on how to limit damage.

column4: Wells Fargo CEO to testify before Senate as questions linger over scandal
column5: WASHINGTON Wells Fargo  Chief Executive Tim Sloan is due to testify before Congress on Oct. 3 as the bank deals with fallout from a sales scandal a year ago that continues to spark new revelations.

column4: Wells Fargo CEO due to testify before Senate banking panel Oct. 3
column5: WASHINGTON  Sept 21 Tim Sloan  the chief executive officer of Wells Fargo  is due to testify before the Senate Banking Committee on October 3  said sources familiar with the scheduled meeting.
